TouNames.string: Offset Buttons If You Can't Vent
Button Cooldowns Are In Decimal Under 10s
The Altruist is a Crewmate Protective role can revive dead players in groups. However, their location and the revived players' locations will be revealed to all Impostors.

Revive a group of dead bodies near you. You will be frozen during the revival and you will be unable to move until the revival is complete. Impostors will also have an arrow pointing towards you during the revival, so be cautious.
Hide Bodies at Beginning Of Revive
Any player abilities used within your aura you will sense
The Aurial is a Crewmate Investigative role that will be alerted whenever a player near them uses one of their abilities.
The Cleric is a Crewmate Protective that can protect crewmates by negating their negative effects, as well as placing barriers on them to prevent interactions.
Prevent a Crewmate from being interacted with. The shield will last for %BarrierCooldown% seconds.
Remove all negative effects on a player. (Douse, Hack, Infect, Blackmail, Blind, Flash, and Hypnosis)
No negative effects were found on %player%.
Hide Bodies at Beginning Of Revive
Camp Crewmates To Catch Their Killer
Inspect Crime Scenes To Catch The Killer"
Maintain Important Systems On The Ship
Use Dead Roles To Benefit The Crew
Find All Impostors By Examining Footprints.
Reveal Yourself To Save The Crew
Create A Shield To Protect A Crewmate
Know When and Where Kills Happen
Get Other Player's To Confess Their Sins
Get The Rats Out Of The Sewers
Reveal The Alliance Of Other Players
Snoop Around And Find Stuff Out
Swap Votes To Save The Crew!
Choose Two Players To Swap Locations
Alert To Kill Anyone Who Interacts With You
Kill Impostors If You Can Guess Their Roles
Remember A Role Of A Deceased Player
Find a dead body to remember and become their role.
The %roleName% is a Neutral Benign role that gains access to a new role from remembering a dead body’s role. Use the role you remember to win the game.
TouNames.String: Remember the role of a dead body. If the dead body's role is a unique role, you will remember the base faction's role instead.
TouNames.string: Show Arrows Pointing To Dead Bodies
Douse Players And Ignite The Light
Douse players and ignite to kill all nearby doused targets.
Douse players and ignite the closest one to kill all doused targets.
The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer alive.
They can douse players and ignite them when close.
They can douse players and ignite one of them to ignite all doused players on the map.
Kill multiple doused players around you, given that they are within your radius.
Kill every doused player on the map as long as you ignite one player close by.
Win by guessing the roles of %doomsayerNeededGuessCount% players.
The %roleName% is a Neutral Evil role that wins by guessing %doomsayerNeededGuessCount% players' roles.
They may observe players to get a hint of what their roles are the following meeting.
Observe a player, gaining a hint in the next meeting what their role could be.
Number Of Guesses Needed To Win
Doomsayer Can Guess Crew Investigative Roles
Doomsayer Guesses All Roles At Once
The %roleName% is a Neutral Evil role that wins by getting their target (signified by %symbol%) ejected in a meeting.
Murder everyone to win with your abilities!
The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer alive. They can Mimic into another player, or they can hack a player.
Mimic the appearance of another player, taking on their whole look.
Move While Using Mimic Menu (KB ONLY)
Protect Your Target With Your Life!
The %roleName% is a Neutral Benign that needs to protect their target (signified by %symbol%) from getting killed/ejected.
Protect your target from getting killed.
Vanquish your Heretics or get them killed.%nl%You will win after every heretic dies.%nlIf they're all dead after a meeting ends,%nlyou'll leave %and% announce your victory

The %roleName% is a Neutral Evil role that wins if their targets (Heretics) die. The only information provided is their roles, and it's up to the Inquisitor to identify those players (marked with %symbol% to the dead) and get them killed by any means necessary.
Inquire a player, which will tell you if they are one of your targets within the meeting.

Vanquish a player to kill them. If they are a heretic, you will be told, and you can continue vanquishing. However, if the victim isn't a heretic, you will lose the ability to vanquish for the rest of the game.
Be as suspicious as possible, and get voted out!
The %roleName% is a Neutral Evil role that wins by getting themselves ejected.
Your Power Grows With Every Kill
With each kill your kill cooldown decreases.
The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer alive. For each kill they get, their kill cooldown gets reduced.
Guard crewmates, and then bribe the winners!
The %roleName% is a Neutral Benign role that can only win by bribing players, allowing them to gain multiple win conditions.
Guarding a player allows the Mercenary to absorb an ability used on the target. This will grant them gold, for Bribing. If any bribed targets win, the Mercenary will win with them.
Bribing a player allows the Mercenary to gain their win condition, given that they have gold to spare.
Kill everyone in your path that interacts with you!
The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that can kill and is invincible to everything but being exiled or guessing incorrectly. They win by being the last killer alive.
Complete all your tasks without being caught!
The %roleName% is a Neutral Ghost role that wins the game by finishing their tasks before a alive player has clicked on them.
The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that needs to infect all other players to turn into the Pestilence.
Infect a player, causing them to be infected. When an infected player or dead body interacts or gets interacted with, the infection will spread to the interacted/interacting player.
Reap The Souls From Your Crewmates
Reap the souls of others, leaving behind a lasting image

The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that takes the soul of players. Instead of leaving a body behind, they leave behind a soul-less decoy that looks identical to the reaped player, standing still.
Reaping acts like a kill button, but instead of making a dead body, makes a fake player in its place, appearing alive.
Do Whatever It Takes To Live
Stay alive to win with any faction remaining
The %roleName% is a Neutral Benign role that just needs to survive until the end of the game.
Put on a Vest protecting you from attacks.
Convert Crewmates And Kill The Rest
The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer(s) alive. They can bite, changing others into Vampires, or kill players.
Bite a player. If the bitten player is a Crewmate and you have not exceeded the maximum amount of vampires in a game yet. You convert them into a vampire. Otherwise, they just get killed.
Max Number Of Vampires Per Game
Rampage to kill everyone in your path
The %roleName% is a Neutral Killing role that wins by being the last killer alive. They can go on a rampage to gain the ability to kill.
Go on a Rampage, gaining the ability to kill and gain Impostor vision. During the Rampage your kill cooldown is significantly lower.
Defy the crew, win with killers.

The Egotist is a Crewmate Alliance modifier (signified by %symbol%). As the Egotist, you can only win if Crewmates lose, even when dead. If no crewmates remain after a meeting ends, you will leave in victory, but the game will continue.
As a %lowerName%, you can chat with your other %lowerName% (signified with %symbol%) during the round, and you can win with your %lowerName% if you are both a part of the final 3 players.
Both Lovers Die And Revive Together
You can call a meeting%nl% from anywhere on the map.
You can button from anywhere on the map.
You can trigger an emergency meeting from across the map, %barryUsages% time(s) per game.
You move %flashSpeed% x faster than regular players.
You are bigger than the average player, moving %giantSpeed%x slower
You are bigger than regular players, and you also move %giantSpeed%x slower than regular players.
You cannot be teleported to the meeting area, and you cannot get dispersed or teleported.
You are unable to be moved via abilities and meetings.
You are smaller than regular players, and you also move %miniSpeed%x faster than regular players.
You are smaller than the average player, moving %miniSpeed%x faster.
Get an arrow to the closest player.
You have an arrow pointing%nl% to the closest player.
You can broadcast a signal to know where dead bodies are.
You can check for bodies on the map, which you can do %broadcastMaxUsages% time(s) per game.
You can check for bodies on the map, which you can do %maxUsages% time(s) per game.
You become transparent when %nl%standing still for a short duration.
You blend in with the environment, becoming transparent when staying still.
Know when someone interacts with you.
You will know when someone uses their ability on you.
Know the roles of bodies you report.
You will see the roles of bodies you report.
Your vote allows you to break ties.
You can also disperse players to vents around the map.
Disperse everyone on the map to a random vent, given that they are not Immovable. You cannot have any other button modifiers with %modifierName%.
You can disperse players on the map to random vents, which you can do once per game.
You also have reduced sabotage cooldowns.
You have a reduced cooldown when sabotaging.
You also know information about teammates' kills%ifDeaths%.
Know When Teammate Fails To Guess
Your kill cooldown is also faster when you're on your own.
When you're alone your kill cooldown is shortened.
Your kill cooldown is lower if you're solo or your teammate is dead.
You also get a second chance when guessing.
You get a second chance when you fail to guess a player in a meeting.
You have an extra chance when assassinating.
You will also trigger your killer's abilities upon death.
Your killer will be forced to use their abilities!
After you die, your killer will be forced to use their abilities, targetting your body or targetting themselves.
You will also force your killer to report your body.
After you die, your killer will self-report, reporting your body.
You will also reveal info about your death in the meeting.
Announce how you died on your passing.
After you die, details about your death will be revealed such as where you were killed and which role killed you during the meeting.
You will also extend your killer's cooldown upon death.
TouNames.String: After you die, your killer's kill cooldown is multiplied by a factor of %diseasedMultiplier%x.
TouNames.string: You will also slow down your killer upon death.
Slow your killer for a short duration.
After you die, your killer will be slowed down!
You can also see through tasks.
All your menus are seethrough, allowing you to look behind menus!
You will also alert all players to your body upon death.
When you die, you will send an alert to all players on the map for %noisemakerTime% second(s).
After your death, you will show a red body indicator to everyone on the map.
Only Triggers If a Body Exists
You can also use security systems on-the-go.
Use cameras at anytime with a limited battery charge.
Your body will also rot away upon death.
Your body will rot away after %rottingDelay% second(s).
After %rottingDelay% second(s), your body will rot away, preventing you from being reported
You can also use vitals on-the-go.
Access vitals anytime, anywhere, as long as you have charge.
Access Vitals at anytime with a limited battery charge.
You can also see farther in light but very low in dark.
Your vision is higher when lights are on, but very low when lights are off.
While you can see twice as far as a regular crewmate, your vision falters when lights are off.
You also finish random tasks each round.
A random task is auto completed for you after each meeting.
Every time a round starts, you will automatically finish a task.
You can also see without lights on.
Your vision won't get reduced%nl%when the lights are sabotaged.
The lights being off do not affect your vision.
